kszucs commented on pull request #5937: ARROW-7293: [Dev] [C++] Persist ccache in docker-compose build volumes
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5937#discussion_r352823130
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/scripts/cpp_build.sh
 ##########
 @@ -31,11 +31,19 @@ elif [ -x "$(command -v xcrun)" ]; then
   export ARROW_GANDIVA_PC_CXX_FLAGS="-isysroot;$(xcrun --show-sdk-path)"
 fi
 
-# export CCACHE_COMPRESS=1
-# export CCACHE_COMPRESSLEVEL=5
-# export CCACHE_COMPILERCHECK=content
-# export CCACHE_DIR=/build/ccache
-# export PATH=/usr/lib/ccache/:$PATH
+export ARROW_USE_CCACHE=${ARROW_USE_CCACHE:-ON}
+
+if [ "${ARROW_USE_CCACHE}" == "ON" ]; then
+    export CCACHE_COMPILERCHECK=content
+    export CCACHE_COMPRESS=1
+    export CCACHE_COMPRESSLEVEL=5
+    export CCACHE_DIR=/build/ccache
+    export CCACHE_MAXSIZE=500M
+    export PATH=/usr/lib/ccache/:$PATH
 
 Review comment:
   @pitrou Is it the same in case of conda as well?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

pitrou commented on issue #5937: ARROW-7293: [Dev] [C++] Persist ccache in docker-compose build volumes
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5937#issuecomment-561133964
 
 
   > as well as forward the environment variable.
   
   I don't think this is useful. We don't forward other ARROW_xxx environment variables. This is mainly to avoid calling `ccache -s` on Windows and macOS (where we don't use Docker).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

kszucs commented on pull request #5937: ARROW-7293: [Dev] [C++] Persist ccache in docker-compose build volumes
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5937#discussion_r353263749
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/scripts/cpp_build.sh
 ##########
 @@ -31,11 +31,19 @@ elif [ -x "$(command -v xcrun)" ]; then
   export ARROW_GANDIVA_PC_CXX_FLAGS="-isysroot;$(xcrun --show-sdk-path)"
 fi
 
-# export CCACHE_COMPRESS=1
-# export CCACHE_COMPRESSLEVEL=5
-# export CCACHE_COMPILERCHECK=content
-# export CCACHE_DIR=/build/ccache
-# export PATH=/usr/lib/ccache/:$PATH
+export ARROW_USE_CCACHE=${ARROW_USE_CCACHE:-ON}
+
+if [ "${ARROW_USE_CCACHE}" == "ON" ]; then
+    export CCACHE_COMPILERCHECK=content
+    export CCACHE_COMPRESS=1
+    export CCACHE_COMPRESSLEVEL=5
+    export CCACHE_DIR=/build/ccache
 
 Review comment:
   What if this directory doesn't exists and the user doesn't set ARROW_USE_CCACHE=OFF explicitly?
   Perhaps it would be better to set CCACHE_DIR from outside and use OFF for ARROW_USE_CCACHE by default, then set it to ON in the base images.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kszucs commented on pull request #5937: ARROW-7293: [Dev] [C++] Persist ccache in docker-compose build volumes
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5937#discussion_r353786661
 
 

 ##########
 File path: ci/scripts/cpp_build.sh
 ##########
 @@ -31,11 +31,19 @@ elif [ -x "$(command -v xcrun)" ]; then
   export ARROW_GANDIVA_PC_CXX_FLAGS="-isysroot;$(xcrun --show-sdk-path)"
 fi
 
-# export CCACHE_COMPRESS=1
-# export CCACHE_COMPRESSLEVEL=5
-# export CCACHE_COMPILERCHECK=content
-# export CCACHE_DIR=/build/ccache
-# export PATH=/usr/lib/ccache/:$PATH
+export ARROW_USE_CCACHE=${ARROW_USE_CCACHE:-ON}
+
+if [ "${ARROW_USE_CCACHE}" == "ON" ]; then
+    export CCACHE_COMPILERCHECK=content
+    export CCACHE_COMPRESS=1
+    export CCACHE_COMPRESSLEVEL=5
+    export CCACHE_DIR=/build/ccache
 
 Review comment:
   It is indeed frustrating. I propose another workaround, set `CCACHE_DIR="${build_dir}/ccache"`. The `build_dir` is received as an argument, so it can be altered from outside of the scripts.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

-# export CCACHE_COMPRESS=1

+    export CCACHE_COMPRESS=1
+    export CCACHE_COMPRESSLEVEL=5

 Review comment:
   Hmm, that's not good. The build dir is a CMake build directory, and we don't want to wipe the ccache if we remove the build directory.
